bitfield.description: TI internal data. Identifies revision of peripheral.
ECC CRC Mode
Energy Efficient Ethernet enable
Port 0 Pass Received CRC errors
Port 0 Receive Short Packet Pad
Port 0 Transmit CRC remove
Port 0 Transmit CRC Type – The type of CRC on all Port 0 transmit packet (egress), regardless of the CRC type of in ingress Ethernet port.
Port 1 Pass Priority Tagged
Port 0 Pass Priority Tagged
Port 0 Enable
VLAN Aware Mode
Emulation Soft Bit
Emulation Free Bit
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.
Port 1 Statistics Enable
Port 0 Statistics Enable
Software Idle

Energy Efficient Ethernet Pre-scale count load value - This value is loaded into the EEE pre-scale counter each time the pre-scale count decrements to zero. The EEE counters are enabled to decrement each time the pre-scale counter reaches zero (and the EEE counters are enabled to count time). If this value is zero then the EEE counters decrement on every clock. If this value is 0x001 then the counters decrement on every other clock (and so on).
Port 0 IPv6 DSCP enable
Port 0 IPv4 DSCP enable
This value is added to the thread/Flow_ID in CPPI transmit PSI Info Word 0
Port 0 Transmit Block Count Usage – This value is the number of blocks allocated to the FIFO logical transmit queues.
Port 0 Receive Block Count Usage – This value is the number of blocks allocated in the receive FIFO.
Port VLAN Priority
Port CFI bit
Port VLAN ID
Receive Priority Type
Receive Rate Limit Enable
Priority 7 – A packet pri of 0x7 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 6 – A packet pri of 0x6 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 5 – A packet pri of 0x5 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 4 – A packet pri of 0x4 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 3 – A packet pri of 0x3 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 2 – A packet pri of 0x2 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 1 – A packet pri of 0x1 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 0 – A packet pri of 0x0 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.

Rx Maximum Frame Length – This field determines the maximum length of a received frame. The reset value is 1518 (dec). Frames with byte counts greater than RX_MAXLEN are long frames. Long frames with no errors are oversized frames. Long frames with CRC, code, or alignment error are jabber frames. The maximum value is 2020 (including VLAN).
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.

Port 0 EEE Idle to LPI counter load value - After EEE_CLKSTOP_REQ is asserted, this value is loaded into the port 0 idle to LPI counter on each clock that the port 0 transmit or receive is not idle. Port 0 enters the LPI state when this count decrements to zero (on the prescale count). This count value should be large relative to switch operations.
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.

Port 0 EEE LPI to wake counter load value – When the port is in the transmit LPI state and the EEE_CLKSTOP_REQ signal is deasserted, this value is loaded into the port 0 LPI to wake counter. Transmit and receive packet operations may begin (resume) when the LPI to wake count decrements to zero (on the prescale count). This is the time waited before CPPI packet operations begin (resume after wakeup). This count value should be large relative to switch operations.
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.
CPPI port 0 transmit FIFO (switch egress) is empty - contains no packets
CPPI port 0 receive FIFO (switch ingress) is empty - contains no packets
CPPI port 0 transmit FIFO hold - asserted in the LPI state and during the LPI2WAKE count time
CPPI port 0 transmit wakeup - asserted in the transmit LPI2WAKE count time
CPPI port 0 transmit LPI state - asserted when the port 0 transmit is in the LPI state
CPPI port 0 receive LPI state - asserted when the port 0 receive is in the LPI state
CPPI port 0 wait idle to LPI - asserted when port 0 is counting the IDLE2LPI time

Port 1 CPPI Info Word0 Source ID Value. This value is contained in the CPPI Info Word 0 src_id field for packets received on port 1.
Reserved register for memory map alignment
Transmit LPI clockstop enable
IPv6 DSCP enable
IPv4 DSCP enable
Transmit FIFO maximum blocks - This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO’s logical transmit priority queues. The recommended value of TX_MAX_BLKS is 0x4.

Receive FIFO maximum blocks – This value is the maximum number of 1k memory blocks that may be allocated to the FIFO’s logical receive queue. This value must be greater than or equal to 0x3. The recommended value of RX_MAX_BLKS is 0x8.
Transmit Block Count Usage – This value is the number of blocks allocated to the port’s FIFO logical transmit queues.
Receive Block Count Usage – This value is the number of blocks allocated to the port’s FIFO receive queue.
Port VLAN Priority (7 is highest priority)
Port CFI bit
Port VLAN ID
Transmit FIFO Blocks that must be free before a non rate-limited CPPI Port 0 receive thread can begin sending a packet
Priority 7 – A packet pri of 0x7 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 6 – A packet pri of 0x6 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 5 – A packet pri of 0x5 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 4 – A packet pri of 0x4 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 3 – A packet pri of 0x3 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 2 – A packet pri of 0x2 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 1 – A packet pri of 0x1 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Priority 0 – A packet pri of 0x0 is mapped (changed) to this header packet pri.
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.

Rx Maximum Frame Length – This field determines the maximum length of a received frame. The reset value is 1518 (dec). Frames with byte counts greater than RX_MAXLEN are long frames. Long frames with no errors are oversized frames. Long frames with CRC, code, or alignment error are jabber frames. The maximum value is 9604 (including VLAN).
Read as zero.

EEE Idle to LPI counter load value- After EEE_CLKSTOP_REQ is asserted, this value is loaded into the port idle to LPI counter on each clock that the port transmit is not idle. The port enters the transmit LPI state when this count decrements to zero. This count decrements each time the EEE prescale count decrements to zero.
Read as zero.

EEE LPI to wake counter load value – When the port is in the transmit LPI state and the EEE_CLKSTOP_REQ signal is deasserted, this value is loaded into the LPI to wake counter. Transmit packet operations may begin (resume) when the LPI to wake count decrements to zero (on the pre-scale count). This is the time waited before Ethernet transmit operations resume after wakeup.
Transmit FIFO (switch egress) is empty - contains no packets
Receive FIFO (switch ingress) is empty - contains no packets
Transmit FIFO hold - asserted in the LPI state and during the LPI2WAKE count time
Transmit wakeup - asserted in the transmit LPI2WAKE count time
Transmit LPI state - asserted when the port 0 transmit is in the LPI state
Receive LPI state - asserted when the port 0 receive is in the LPI state
CPPI port 0 wait idle to LPI - asserted when port 0 is counting the IDLE2LPI time

Source Address Lower 8 bits (byte 0)

Time Sync Message Type Enable Each bit in this field enables the corresponding message type in receive and transmit time sync messages (Bit 0 enables message type 0, etc.).
Time Sync Transmit Host Time Stamp Enable
Time Sync Transmit Annex E Enable
Time Sync Receive Annex E Enable
Time Sync LTYPE 2 enable (Transmit and Receive)
Time Sync Transmit Annex D Enable
Time Sync Transmit VLAN LTYPE 2 enable
Time Sync Transmit VLAN LTYPE 1 enable
Time Sync Transmit Annex F Enable
Time Sync Receive Annex D Enable
Time Sync Receive VLAN LTYPE 2 enable
Time Sync Receive VLAN LTYPE 1 enable
Time Sync Receive Annex F Enable
Time Sync Sequence ID Offset. This is the number of octets that the sequence ID is offset in the tx and rx time sync message header. The minimum value is 6.
Time Sync LTYPE1. This is the port’s time sync LTYPE1 value.
Time Sync VLAN LTYPE2. This VLAN LTYPE value is used for the port tx and rx time sync decode.
Time Sync VLAN LTYPE1. This VLAN LTYPE value is used for the port tx and rx time sync decode.
Time Sync Unicast Enable
Time Sync Time to Live Non-zero Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 320 Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 319 Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 132 Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 131 Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 130 Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 129 Enable
Time Sync Destination IP Address 107 Enable
Time Sync LTYPE2. This is the time sync LTYPE1 value for port 1.
Time Sync Domain Offset
Time Sync Multicast Destination Address Type Enable
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.

RX Copy MAC Control Frames Enable – Enables MAC control frames to be transferred to memory. MAC control frames are normally acted upon (if enabled), but not copied to memory. MAC control frames that are pause frames will be acted upon if enabled in the MacControl register, regardless of the value of RX_CMF_EN. Frames transferred to memory due toRX_CMF_EN will have the control bit set in their EOP buffer descriptor.

Enables frames or fragments shorter than 64 bytes to be copied to memory. Frames transferred to memory due to rx_csf_en will have the fragment or undersized bit set in their receive footer. Fragments are short frames that contain CRC/align/code errors and undersized are short frames without errors.

RX Copy Error Frames Enable – Enables frames containing errors to be transferred to memory. The appropriate error bit will be set in the frame receive footer. Frames containing errors will be filtered when rx_cef _en is not set.
External Transmit Flow Control Enable Enables the tx_flow_en to be selected from the EXT_TX_FLOW_EN input signal and not from the TX_FLOW_EN bit in this register.
External Receive Flow Control Enable – Enables the rx_flow_en to be selected from the EXT_RX_FLOW_EN input signal and not from the RX_FLOW_EN bit in this register.

Control Enable – Enables the fullduplex and gigabit mode to be selected from the FULLDUPLEX_IN and GIG_IN input signals and not from the fullduplex and gig bits in this register. The FULLDUPLEX_MODE bit reflects the actual fullduplex mode selected.
Gigabit Mode Force – This bit is used to force the Enet Mac into gigabit mode if the input GMII_MTCLK has been stopped by the PHY.
Interface Control B
Interface Control A.Determines the RMII speed
Port CRC Type
Command Idle
Gigabit Mode The GIG_OUT output is the value of this bit.
Transmit Pacing Enable
GMII Enable

Transmit Flow Control Enable – Determines if incoming pause frames are acted upon in full-duplex mode. Incoming pause frames are not acted upon in half-duplex mode regardless of this bit setting. The RX_MBP_Enable bits determine whether or not received pause frames are transferred to memory.
Receive Flow Control Enable
Manufacturing Test Mode – This bit must be set to allow writes to the BACKOFF_TEST and PAUSETIMER registers.
Loop Back Mode – Loopback mode forces internal fullduplex mode regardless of whether the fullduplex bit is set or not. The loopback bit should be changed only when GMII_EN is de-asserted.
Full Duplex mode – Gigabit mode forces fullduplex mode regardless of whether the fullduplex bit is set or not. The FULLDUPLEX_OUT output is the value of this register bit
Enet IDLE – The Ethernet port is in the idle state (valid after an idle command)
External Receive Flow Control Enable – This is the value of the EXT_RX_FLOW_EN input bit.
External Receive Flow Control Enable – This is the value of the EXT_TX_FLOW_EN input bit.
External GIG mode – This is the value of the EXT_GIG input bit.
External Fullduplex – This is the value of the EXT_FULLDUPLEX input bit.
Receive Flow Control Active – When asserted, indicates that receive flow control is enabled and triggered.

Transmit Flow Control Active When asserted, this bit indicates that the pause time period is being observed for a received pause frame. No new transmissions will begin while this bit is asserted except for the transmission of pause frames. Any transmission in progress when this bit is asserted will complete.
Reads return 0 and writes have no effect.

Software reset – Writing a one to this bit causes the Ethernet Mac logic to be reset. After writing a one to this bit, it may be polled to determine if the reset has occurred. If a one is read, the reset has not yet occurred. If a zero is read then reset has occurred.

Pacing Register Current Value. A non-zero value in this field indicates that transmit pacing is active. A transmit frame collision or deferral causes paceval to loaded with decimal 31, good frame transmissions (with no collisions or deferrals) cause paceval to be decremented down to zero. When paceval is nonzero, the transmitter delays 4 IPGs between new frame transmissions after each successfully transmitted frame that had no deferrals or collisions. Transmit pacing helps reduce “capture” effects improving overall network bandwidth.

Backoff Random Number Generator – This field allows the Backoff Random Number Generator to be read (or written in test mode only). This field can be written only when mtest has previously been set. Reading this field returns the generator’s current value. The value is reset to zero and begins counting on the clock after the de-assertion of reset
Collision Count – The number of collisions the current frame has experienced.

Backoff Count – This field allows the current value of the backoff counter to be observed for test purposes. This field is loaded automatically according to the backoff algorithm, and is decremented by one for each slot time after the collision.

RX Pause Timer Value – This field allows the contents of the receive pause timer to be observed (and written in test mode). The receive pause timer is loaded with 0xFF00 when the Enet port sends an outgoing pause frame (with pause time of 0xFFFF). The receive pause timer is decremented at slot time intervals. If the receive pause timer decrements to zero, then another outgoing pause frame will be sent and the load/decrement process will be repeated. This register is for 802.3 Based flow control and is not used for 802.1qbb Priority Based Flow Control (PFC).

802.3 Tx Pause Timer Value – This field allows the contents of the transmit pause timer to be observed (and written in test mode). The transmit pause timer is loaded by a received (incoming) pause frame, and then decremented, at slottime intervals, down to zero at which time Ethernet Port transmit frames are again enabled. This register is for 802.3 Based flow control and is not used for 802.1qbb Priority Based Flow Control (PFC).
Emulation Soft Bit
Emulation Free Bit
Transmit Inter-Packet Gap This is the default gap value and only bits 8:0 are used. This can be increased from 12 to increase the gap between packets.
